#50km

```{r}
df_50 <- read_dta("data/data_dta/df_50.dta")

df_50 <- na.omit(subset(df_50, select = c("pol_trust","dist_cap_max_norm","dist_sndncap_max_norm","age","age_2","sex","educ_sec", "bin_rural","bin_conditions_eco","bin_conditions_country", "bin_emp", "night_region_log","pop_region_log", "area_region_log", "disc_pol_a", "tele_news", "paper_news", "radio_news", "bin_unfair_eth", "pres_adm1", "round", "country_round","murdock_names","cluster_bdd", "distance_border", "distance_border_km", "distance_border_km2", "distance_border_km3", "gdppc_log",  "vdem_polyarchy", "color_num", "cor_index", "area_log", "gov_num", "mountain_region_tv", "desert_region_tv")))

reg3_50 <- lm_robust(pol_trust~dist_cap_max_norm+dist_sndncap_max_norm+age+age_2+factor(sex)+ factor(educ_sec) +factor(bin_rural)+
                             factor(bin_conditions_eco)+ factor(bin_conditions_country)+ factor(bin_emp)+ disc_pol_a+ tele_news + paper_news + radio_news + night_region_log  + pop_region_log+ area_region_log+gdppc_log+vdem_polyarchy + factor(color_num)+cor_index+area_log+ factor(gov_num) + desert_region_tv + mountain_region_tv + factor(bin_unfair_eth), clusters = cluster_bdd, data = df_50)

summary(reg3_50)

df_50$ft_values <- fitted(reg3_50)
```

```{r}
#Pour les gens près de la capitale (sous la médiane), on rend la distance à la frontière négative (cf. on multiplie par -1)
df_50$distance_border <- ifelse(df_50$dist_cap_max_norm<median(df_50$dist_cap_max_norm),
                                       -df_50$distance_border,df_50$distance_border)

#On crée une base avec les gens près et une avec les gens loin
df_50_pres <- subset(df_50, df_50$distance_border<=0)#ici c'est les 50% les plus près, donc la valeur sous 0 (voir ligne précedente)
df_50_loin <- subset(df_50, df_50$distance_border>=0)#ici c'est les 50% les plus loin, donc la valeur au dessus de 0 (voir ligne précedente)

#On définit 10 intervalles
nb_intervals <- 50

#On découpe les deux bases en 10 intervalles
intervals_dist_border_pres <- cut(df_50_pres$distance_border, breaks = nb_intervals)
intervals_dist_border_loin <- cut(df_50_loin$distance_border, breaks = nb_intervals)



#On fait la moyenne par intervalle pour la distance à la frontière et le fitted trust pour la base près
mean_dist_border_intervals_pres <- data.frame(tapply(df_50_pres$distance_border, intervals_dist_border_pres, mean))
mean_trust_intervals_pres <- data.frame(tapply(df_50_pres$ft_values, intervals_dist_border_pres, mean))

#On renomme les colonnes
colnames(mean_dist_border_intervals_pres) <- "mean_dist_border_intervals"
colnames(mean_trust_intervals_pres) <- "mean_trust_intervals"

#On fait la moyenne par intervalle pour la distance à la frontière et le fitted trust pour la base loin
mean_dist_border_intervals_loin <- data.frame(tapply(df_50_loin$distance_border, intervals_dist_border_loin, mean))
mean_trust_intervals_loin <- data.frame(tapply(df_50_loin$ft_values, intervals_dist_border_loin, mean))

#On renomme les colonnes
colnames(mean_dist_border_intervals_loin) <- "mean_dist_border_intervals"
colnames(mean_trust_intervals_loin) <- "mean_trust_intervals"


#On fussionne les bases près et loin
mean_dist_border_intervals <- rbind(mean_dist_border_intervals_pres,mean_dist_border_intervals_loin)
mean_trust_intervals <- rbind(mean_trust_intervals_pres,mean_trust_intervals_loin)

data_intervals <- cbind(mean_dist_border_intervals,mean_trust_intervals)


#Les intervalles de confiance pour le trust
lower_distance_fun <- function(x) {
  mean_val <- mean(x)
  conf_int <- t.test(x)$conf.int
  ic95_ <- abs(conf_int[1] - mean_val)
  ic95_
}

#On fait les intervalles de confiance pour chaque intervalle (50 en tout, 10 près + 10 loin)
mean_trust_intervals_pres_ic <- data.frame(tapply(df_50_pres$ft_values, intervals_dist_border_pres, lower_distance_fun))
mean_trust_intervals_loin_ic <- data.frame(tapply(df_50_loin$ft_values, intervals_dist_border_loin, lower_distance_fun))
colnames(mean_trust_intervals_pres_ic) <- "ic_trust"
colnames(mean_trust_intervals_loin_ic) <- "ic_trust"

#On met toutes les intervalles dans la même base
mean_trust_intervals_ic <- rbind(mean_trust_intervals_pres_ic,mean_trust_intervals_loin_ic)

data_intervals_ic <- cbind(data_intervals,mean_trust_intervals_ic)

#Les moyenne près/loin pour les lignes sur le graph
moy_trust_pres <- mean(df_50_pres$ft_values)
moy_trust_loin <- mean(df_50_loin$ft_values)

```

```{r}
# Create modified datasets with points at the boundary and extremes
data_left <- subset(data_intervals_ic, mean_dist_border_intervals <= 0)
data_right <- subset(data_intervals_ic, mean_dist_border_intervals >= 0)

# Find the min and max values in your x range
x_min <- -50000  # -50 km in your units
x_max <- 50000   # 50 km in your units

# Find the predicted values at x=0, x_min, and x_max for each curve
left_model <- lm(mean_trust_intervals ~ poly(mean_dist_border_intervals, 3), data=data_left)
right_model <- lm(mean_trust_intervals ~ poly(mean_dist_border_intervals, 3), data=data_right)

y_at_zero_left <- predict(left_model, newdata=data.frame(mean_dist_border_intervals=0))
y_at_min <- predict(left_model, newdata=data.frame(mean_dist_border_intervals=x_min))

y_at_zero_right <- predict(right_model, newdata=data.frame(mean_dist_border_intervals=0))
y_at_max <- predict(right_model, newdata=data.frame(mean_dist_border_intervals=x_max))

# Average confidence interval for the added points
avg_ic_left <- mean(data_left$ic_trust)
avg_ic_right <- mean(data_right$ic_trust)

# Add points at x=0 and x=x_min to left dataset
data_left_plus <- rbind(data_left, 
                        data.frame(
                          mean_dist_border_intervals = 0,
                          mean_trust_intervals = y_at_zero_left,
                          ic_trust = avg_ic_left
                        ),
                        data.frame(
                          mean_dist_border_intervals = x_min,
                          mean_trust_intervals = y_at_min,
                          ic_trust = avg_ic_left
                        ))

# Add points at x=0 and x=x_max to right dataset
data_right_plus <- rbind(data_right, 
                         data.frame(
                           mean_dist_border_intervals = 0,
                           mean_trust_intervals = y_at_zero_right,
                           ic_trust = avg_ic_right
                         ),
                         data.frame(
                           mean_dist_border_intervals = x_max,
                           mean_trust_intervals = y_at_max,
                           ic_trust = avg_ic_right
                         ))
```

```{r}
ggplot(data_intervals_ic, aes(x = mean_dist_border_intervals, y = mean_trust_intervals)) +
  # Add vertical line at border
  geom_vline(xintercept = 0, linetype = "dashed", color = "gray40", size = 0.7) + 
  
  # Left side smooth curve (Close to Capital)
# Left side smooth curve (Close to Capital)
geom_smooth(data = data_left_plus,
            aes(x = mean_dist_border_intervals, y = mean_trust_intervals),
            method = "lm", formula = y ~ poly(x, 3), 
            color = "firebrick", size = 1.2, se = TRUE,
            fill="firebrick",
            alpha=0.1,
            level = 0.90, show.legend = FALSE) +

# Right side smooth curve (Far from Capital)
geom_smooth(data = data_right_plus,
            aes(x = mean_dist_border_intervals, y = mean_trust_intervals),
            method = "lm", formula = y ~ poly(x, 3), 
            color = "darkgreen", size = 1.2, se = TRUE,
            fill = "darkgreen",
            alpha = 0.1,
            level = 0.90, show.legend = FALSE)+

geom_segment(aes(x = -50000, 
                   xend = 0,
                   y = moy_trust_pres, 
                   yend = moy_trust_pres, linetype = "Close"),
             inherit.aes = FALSE,
             color = "firebrick", size = 1.5, alpha = 0.7, data = data.frame()) + 
  geom_segment(aes(x = 0, 
                   xend =50000, 
                   y = moy_trust_loin, 
                   yend = moy_trust_loin, linetype = "Far"),
               inherit.aes = FALSE,
               color = "darkgreen", size = 1.5, alpha = 0.7, data = data.frame()) +  
  
  # Add annotations in better positions with borders
  
  annotate("label", x = -max(abs(data_intervals$mean_dist_border_intervals)) * 0.5, 
           y = max(data_intervals_ic$mean_trust_intervals) + 0.05, 
           label = "Close to the Capital", 
           size = 7, fill = "mistyrose", color = "firebrick", fontface = "bold", 
           label.size = 0.5, family = "Arial") +
  annotate("label", x = max(abs(data_intervals$mean_dist_border_intervals)) * 0.5, 
           y = max(data_intervals_ic$mean_trust_intervals) + 0.05, 
           label = "Far from the Capital", 
           size = 7, fill = "honeydew", color = "darkgreen", fontface = "bold", 
           label.size = 0.5, family = "Arial") +
  
  # Add legend for mean lines
  scale_linetype_manual(name = NULL, 
                        values = c("Close" = "dashed","Far" = "dashed"),
                        labels = c(expression(bar(y)[far]), expression(bar(y)[close]))) +

  # Set appropriate axis limits
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(-max(abs(data_intervals$mean_dist_border_intervals)), 
                          max(abs(data_intervals$mean_dist_border_intervals))),
                 ylim = c(min(data_intervals_ic$mean_trust_intervals) - 0.05,
                         max(data_intervals_ic$mean_trust_intervals) + 0.1)) +
  
  # Format axes
scale_x_continuous(labels = function(x) abs(x) / 1000,
                     breaks = seq(-50000, 50000, 10000)) +  
  # Add clear labels
  labs(x = "Distance from the Border (in km)",
      y = "Political Trust") +
  
  # Polish theme
theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    text = element_text(family = "Arial"),
    plot.title = element_text(size = 25, hjust = 0.5, face = "bold", margin = margin(b = 10)),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 20, hjust = 0.5, margin = margin(b = 20)),
    axis.title.x = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold", margin = margin(t = 25)),
    axis.title.y = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold", margin = margin(r = 25)),
    axis.text = element_text(size = 11),
    axis.ticks = element_line(color = "black"),  # Keep the ticks
    axis.ticks.length = unit(5, "pt"),  # Adjust the length of the ticks if needed
    axis.line = element_line(color = "black"),  # Ensure the axis lines are visible
    legend.position = c(0.85, 0.2),
    legend.background = element_rect(fill = alpha('white'), color = "gray80"),
    legend.title = element_text(size = 12),
    legend.text = element_text(size = 20),
    panel.grid.major.x = element_blank(),  # Remove vertical major grid lines
    panel.grid.minor.x = element_blank(),  # Remove vertical minor grid lines
    panel.grid.major.y = element_line(color = "gray90"),  # Keep horizontal major grid lines
    panel.grid.minor.y = element_blank(),  # Remove horizontal minor grid lines
    plot.margin = margin(t = 20, r = 20, b = 18, l = 18)
  )
```

```{r}
#Pour les gens près de la capitale (sous la médiane), on rend la distance à la frontière négative (cf. on multiplie par -1)
df_30$distance_border <- ifelse(df_30$dist_cap_max_norm<median(df_30$dist_cap_max_norm),
                                       -df_30$distance_border,df_30$distance_border)

#On crée une base avec les gens près et une avec les gens loin
df_30_pres <- subset(df_30, df_30$distance_border<=0)#ici c'est les 50% les plus près, donc la valeur sous 0 (voir ligne précedente)
df_30_loin <- subset(df_30, df_30$distance_border>=0)#ici c'est les 50% les plus loin, donc la valeur au dessus de 0 (voir ligne précedente)

#On définit 10 intervalles
nb_intervals <- 30

#On découpe les deux bases en 10 intervalles
intervals_dist_border_pres <- cut(df_30_pres$distance_border, breaks = nb_intervals)
intervals_dist_border_loin <- cut(df_30_loin$distance_border, breaks = nb_intervals)



#On fait la moyenne par intervalle pour la distance à la frontière et le fitted trust pour la base près
mean_dist_border_intervals_pres <- data.frame(tapply(df_30_pres$distance_border, intervals_dist_border_pres, mean))
mean_trust_intervals_pres <- data.frame(tapply(df_30_pres$ft_values, intervals_dist_border_pres, mean))

#On renomme les colonnes
colnames(mean_dist_border_intervals_pres) <- "mean_dist_border_intervals"
colnames(mean_trust_intervals_pres) <- "mean_trust_intervals"

#On fait la moyenne par intervalle pour la distance à la frontière et le fitted trust pour la base loin
mean_dist_border_intervals_loin <- data.frame(tapply(df_30_loin$distance_border, intervals_dist_border_loin, mean))
mean_trust_intervals_loin <- data.frame(tapply(df_30_loin$ft_values, intervals_dist_border_loin, mean))

colnames(mean_dist_border_intervals_loin) <- "mean_dist_border_intervals"
colnames(mean_trust_intervals_loin) <- "mean_trust_intervals"


#On fussionne les bases près et loin
mean_dist_border_intervals <- rbind(mean_dist_border_intervals_pres,mean_dist_border_intervals_loin)
mean_trust_intervals <- rbind(mean_trust_intervals_pres,mean_trust_intervals_loin)

data_intervals <- cbind(mean_dist_border_intervals,mean_trust_intervals)


#Les intervalles de confiance pour le trust
lower_distance_fun <- function(x) {
  mean_val <- mean(x)
  conf_int <- t.test(x)$conf.int
  ic95_ <- abs(conf_int[1] - mean_val)
  ic95_
}

#On fait les intervalles de confiance pour chaque intervalle (30 en tout, 10 près + 10 loin)
mean_trust_intervals_pres_ic <- data.frame(tapply(df_30_pres$ft_values, intervals_dist_border_pres, lower_distance_fun))
mean_trust_intervals_loin_ic <- data.frame(tapply(df_30_loin$ft_values, intervals_dist_border_loin, lower_distance_fun))
colnames(mean_trust_intervals_pres_ic) <- "ic_trust"
colnames(mean_trust_intervals_loin_ic) <- "ic_trust"

#On met toutes les intervalles dans la même base
mean_trust_intervals_ic <- rbind(mean_trust_intervals_pres_ic,mean_trust_intervals_loin_ic)

data_intervals_ic <- cbind(data_intervals,mean_trust_intervals_ic)

#Les moyenne près/loin pour les lignes sur le graph
moy_trust_pres <- mean(df_30_pres$ft_values)
moy_trust_loin <- mean(df_30_loin$ft_values)
```

```{r}
#Pour les gens près de la capitale (sous la médiane), on rend la distance à la frontière négative (cf. on multiplie par -1)
df_20$distance_border <- ifelse(df_20$dist_cap_max_norm<median(df_20$dist_cap_max_norm),
                                       -df_20$distance_border,df_20$distance_border)

#On crée une base avec les gens près et une avec les gens loin
df_20_pres <- subset(df_20, df_20$distance_border<=0)#ici c'est les 50% les plus près, donc la valeur sous 0 (voir ligne précedente)
df_20_loin <- subset(df_20, df_20$distance_border>=0)#ici c'est les 50% les plus loin, donc la valeur au dessus de 0 (voir ligne précedente)

#On définit 10 intervalles
nb_intervals <- 20

#On découpe les deux bases en 10 intervalles
intervals_dist_border_pres <- cut(df_20_pres$distance_border, breaks = nb_intervals)
intervals_dist_border_loin <- cut(df_20_loin$distance_border, breaks = nb_intervals)



#On fait la moyenne par intervalle pour la distance à la frontière et le fitted trust pour la base près
mean_dist_border_intervals_pres <- data.frame(tapply(df_20_pres$distance_border, intervals_dist_border_pres, mean))
mean_trust_intervals_pres <- data.frame(tapply(df_20_pres$ft_values, intervals_dist_border_pres, mean))

#On renomme les colonnes
colnames(mean_dist_border_intervals_pres) <- "mean_dist_border_intervals"
colnames(mean_trust_intervals_pres) <- "mean_trust_intervals"

#On fait la moyenne par intervalle pour la distance à la frontière et le fitted trust pour la base loin
mean_dist_border_intervals_loin <- data.frame(tapply(df_20_loin$distance_border, intervals_dist_border_loin, mean))
mean_trust_intervals_loin <- data.frame(tapply(df_20_loin$ft_values, intervals_dist_border_loin, mean))

#On renomme les colonnes
colnames(mean_dist_border_intervals_loin) <- "mean_dist_border_intervals"
colnames(mean_trust_intervals_loin) <- "mean_trust_intervals"


#On fussionne les bases près et loin
mean_dist_border_intervals <- rbind(mean_dist_border_intervals_pres,mean_dist_border_intervals_loin)
mean_trust_intervals <- rbind(mean_trust_intervals_pres,mean_trust_intervals_loin)

data_intervals <- cbind(mean_dist_border_intervals,mean_trust_intervals)


#Les intervalles de confiance pour le trust
lower_distance_fun <- function(x) {
  mean_val <- mean(x)
  conf_int <- t.test(x)$conf.int
  ic95_ <- abs(conf_int[1] - mean_val)
  ic95_
}

#On fait les intervalles de confiance pour chaque intervalle (20 en tout, 10 près + 10 loin)
mean_trust_intervals_pres_ic <- data.frame(tapply(df_20_pres$ft_values, intervals_dist_border_pres, lower_distance_fun))
mean_trust_intervals_loin_ic <- data.frame(tapply(df_20_loin$ft_values, intervals_dist_border_loin, lower_distance_fun))
colnames(mean_trust_intervals_pres_ic) <- "ic_trust"
colnames(mean_trust_intervals_loin_ic) <- "ic_trust"

#On met toutes les intervalles dans la même base
mean_trust_intervals_ic <- rbind(mean_trust_intervals_pres_ic,mean_trust_intervals_loin_ic)

data_intervals_ic <- cbind(data_intervals,mean_trust_intervals_ic)

#Les moyenne près/loin pour les lignes sur le graph
moy_trust_pres <- mean(df_20_pres$ft_values)
moy_trust_loin <- mean(df_20_loin$ft_values)

```

```{r}
# Create modified datasets with points at the boundary and extremes
data_left <- subset(data_intervals_ic, mean_dist_border_intervals <= 0)
data_right <- subset(data_intervals_ic, mean_dist_border_intervals >= 0)

# Find the min and max values in your x range
x_min <- -20000  # -20 km in your units
x_max <- 20000   # 20 km in your units

# Find the predicted values at x=0, x_min, and x_max for each curve
left_model <- lm(mean_trust_intervals ~ poly(mean_dist_border_intervals, 3), data=data_left)
right_model <- lm(mean_trust_intervals ~ poly(mean_dist_border_intervals, 3), data=data_right)

y_at_zero_left <- predict(left_model, newdata=data.frame(mean_dist_border_intervals=0))
y_at_min <- predict(left_model, newdata=data.frame(mean_dist_border_intervals=x_min))

y_at_zero_right <- predict(right_model, newdata=data.frame(mean_dist_border_intervals=0))
y_at_max <- predict(right_model, newdata=data.frame(mean_dist_border_intervals=x_max))

# Average confidence interval for the added points
avg_ic_left <- mean(data_left$ic_trust)
avg_ic_right <- mean(data_right$ic_trust)

# Add points at x=0 and x=x_min to left dataset
data_left_plus <- rbind(data_left, 
                        data.frame(
                          mean_dist_border_intervals = 0,
                          mean_trust_intervals = y_at_zero_left,
                          ic_trust = avg_ic_left
                        ),
                        data.frame(
                          mean_dist_border_intervals = x_min,
                          mean_trust_intervals = y_at_min,
                          ic_trust = avg_ic_left
                        ))

# Add points at x=0 and x=x_max to right dataset
data_right_plus <- rbind(data_right, 
                         data.frame(
                           mean_dist_border_intervals = 0,
                           mean_trust_intervals = y_at_zero_right,
                           ic_trust = avg_ic_right
                         ),
                         data.frame(
                           mean_dist_border_intervals = x_max,
                           mean_trust_intervals = y_at_max,
                           ic_trust = avg_ic_right
                         ))
```
